Art. 4.175. 
An action for revocation on the ground of ingratitude 
An application for revocation on the ground of ingratitude must be made within one year from the day of the offence imputed by the donor to the donee, or from the day when the offence could have been known by the donor.
The donor may request revocation against the donee and, after the latter's death, against his heirs.
The donor's heirs may only request revocation if:   
1¡ the donor had already brought the action; 
2¡ the donor died within one year from either the day of the tort or the day on which he was able to learn of the tort; the heirs must then bring the action within one year from either the day of the tort or the day on which the donor was able to learn of the tort;
3¡ the donor died without knowledge of the offence; the heirs must then bring the action within one year of either the day of death, the day on which they had knowledge of the offence or the day on which they had knowledge of the gift.
